723852f-a.text:
Wall St. from Broad St.  182S

723852f-a.folder: Wall Street & Broad Street, Manhattan, NY

723848f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Broad Street
723848f-a.text:
Wall Street, east from a point to the east of Broad Street.
In the right center is the distinctive Merchants Exchange.
This occupies the entire block frontage from William to
Hanover Street's. It is later to become the U. S. Custom
House. On their removal to the new Custom House at Bowling
Green, the National City Bank will take over. Note the
ncaffold suspended at the corner.
About 1860
Gift of Urbrock Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED
723848f-a.folder: Wall Street & Broad Street, Manhattan, NY

723862f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Broad Street
723862f-a.text:
Wall Street, west across Broad \& Nassau Streets, to
Broadway. At the latter point appears the dominant (then)
feature, Trinity Church. at the right margin are the steps
of the U. S. Sub Treasury prior to the erection of the
Washington statue there in 1883. Beyond same is a five
story building at the N. W. corner of Nassau Street. This
was increased two stories in heighth and became the Manhat-
tan Trust Co. The structure on the left center housing
''Kiernants'' is the predecessor of the Wilks Building.
Between 1872.80
Gift of Urbrock Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED
Ng ~2077
723862f-a.folder: Wall Street & Broad Street, Manhattan, NY

723863f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Broad Street
723863f-a.text:
Wall Street, west across Broad \& Nassau Street's, to
Broadway. At the latter point is the dominant Trinity
Church. The four corners in the center are occupied by,
the Drexel Morgan Bldg., the Kiernan Telegraphic Agency,
the 5 story (later 7) structure soon to be the Manhattan
Trust Co. home and the U. S. Sub Treasury. Note the absence
of the Washington statue on the steps of the latter.
N4eg e 33o
Between 1872280

the )pires of Trinity Church. At the rigght of picture

Nassau.
No date,nor record.

723865f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Broad Street
723865f-a.text:
Wall Street, west from Broad \&: Nassau Streets, to
Broadway, showing at the 1atter point, Trinity Church.
New Street intersects at the left. Note the absence
of the National Bank of the Republic (Fort Sherman)
that was erected in 1880 at the N.E. corner of Broad-
way. A comparison with other views leads the writer
to conclude that this photo dates between 1872-1880.
Between 1872-1883

716887f-a.text:
8-60 Broad Street, west side, from south of Aall Street to

Stock Exchange. In the left background is the tower of the re-
oently built Produce Exchange.
1885.

716840f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Wall Street
716840f-a.text:
Broad Street, west side, south from, but not including Wall Street.
Building shown on the extreme right, is the old N.Y. Stock Exchange.
The building with the tower, is the N.Y. Produce Exchange.
About 1885.
New York Edison Co.

716861f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Wall Street
716861f-a.text:
Broad Street, west side, south from, but not including Wall, to, but
not including Beaver Streets. 3uilding shown on the extreme right, is the
old Stock Exchango. In the background appears the tower of the N.Y. Pro-

716884f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Wall Street
716884f-a.text:
No's. 6 and 8-10 Broad Street, adjoining and
south of the S.W. corner of Wall Street, and showing prominently
the New York Stock Exchange Building of an early period.
1889
0ift of Urbrock Collection

716884f-a.folder: Broad Street & Wall Street, Manhattan, NY

716834f.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Wall Street
716834f.text:
Broad Street, south from Wall Street,
showing mainly the westerly side of this thoroughfare.
To the left, center, and right respectively wre, the old
Mills Building (replaced in 1926 by the 38-story Equitable
Trust Co. Building), the Produce Exchange (distinctive tower
wtop) and the New York Stock Exchange Building. Adjoining
the latter is the renovated 6-story building adjoining the
corner structure. These were subsequently demolished and
their site improved by w larger building and which in time
was replaced by the north wing of the Stock Exchange.
See King's Handbook of New York (1893),
page 155 for a slightly later view.
Between 1889-1893
Gift Thru New York Historical Society
MAY BE REDRODUCED
716834f.folder: Broad Street & Wall Street, Manhattan, NY

723896f.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Nassau Street
723896f.text:
Wall Street, west across Nassau Street, showing prom-
inently the J. 9Q. A. Ward statue of Washington on the U.S.
Sub Treasury steps . To the left center is Trinity Church
at Broadway. Between these features appear the dark Nat-
ional Bank of the Republic and the white marble Manhattan
Trust Co. home. The newly erected Mortimer Bldg. is at
the left margin at New Street.
1890
Gift of Urbrock Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED
Ne.~2S41
723896f.folder: Wall Street & Nassau Street, Manhattan, NY

723885f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Broad Street
723885f-a.text:
Tall Street, south side, west and across Broad Street
(left), as photographed from the Sub Treasury steps. The
frontage refered to is in the center and extends from Broad
Street on the left to New Street. The latter thoroughfare
is behind the Washington statue. Note the Mortimer Building
there. A glimpse of Trinity Church on Broadway appears
behind the statue. Under demolition are the corner struc-
tures to provide a site for the new Wilks Building. Event-
ually all of these buildings will vanish for the ever expand-
ing New York Stock Fxchange.
About 1890
Gift of Urbrock Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED
723885f-a.folder: Wall Street & Broad Street, Manhattan, NY

716835f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Wall Street
716835f-a.text:
Broad Street, south from Wall Street, showing
prominently the westerly side of this important
thoroughfare.
At the extreme right is the Wilks Building
separated from the New York Stock Exchange Building
by a renovated (between 1889-1893) five-story structure.
Towering above same is the graceful Mackey Building.
The Johnston Building is to the south,while beyond
appears the dim outline of the Produce Exchange. Note
beteeen these the Edison Building.
At the left margin is the DRexel Building and its
adjoining Mills structure.
About 1893
Gift of Urbrock CollecTion
MAY BE REPRODUCED
716835f-a.folder: Broad Street & Wall Street, Manhattan, NY

716862f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Wall Street
716862f-a.text:
Broad Street, west side, south from but not including Wall, to,
but not including Beaver Streets. Also shown is the S.E. corner of
Wall and Broad Streets, which is occupied by Drexel, Morgan and Co.
About 1893.
P. L. Sperr.
(Taken by August Loeffler)

716862f-a.folder: Broad Street & Wall Street, Manhattan, NY

723864f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Broad Street
723864f-a.text:
Wall Street, west across Broad (left) and Nassau (right)
Street's, to Broadway, showing the westerly extremity of
this financial thoroughfare headed by Trinity Church. At
the four corners in the foreground are, the Drexel Morgan
\& Co. Building, the Wilks Building, the Manhattan Trust Co.
Building and the U. S. Sub Treasury. Adjoining the latter
is the old Assay Office. To the right of the Church is
the darkened National Bank of the Republic popularly known
as ''Fort Sherman''.
1894
Copyrisht, 1894
J. S. Johnston, phoo
Girt or Urbrock Collection

including Broadway, showing the front view of Trinity Church.

716842f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Wall Street
716842f-a.text:
Broad Street, west side, south from Wall Street.
At the left and right margins respectively are,
the Drexel, Morgan \& Co. Dldg. and the Tew York
Stock Exchange. Two doors beyond the latter is
Commercial Cable ('ackey) Bldg. under constructio3.
Separating this and the Johnston Bldg. are two
small structures on this side of Exchange Place.
These will shortly provide the site for the Blair
Bldg. This photo is an enlargement from an origi-
hnal lantern slide.
Circa 1896
Gift of Russell Freeman
ew York Public Library

723890f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Nassau Street
723890f-a.text:
Wall Street, at the N. E. corner of Nassau Street,
showing the U. S. Sub Treasury steps and the J. Q. A.
Ward statue of Washington thereupon. The inscription
reads '' Erected By Voluntary Subscription Under The
Auspices Of The Chamber Of Commerce Of The State Of
New York, November 26, 1883.''
About 1900
Gift of Urbrock Collection

716833f.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Wall Street
716833f.text:
Broad Street, adjoining the S.W. corner of Wall
Street, showing the facade of the New York Stock Exchange
Building.
The center figure represents ''Integrity.'' On the
right the groups represent ''Frimitive Agriculture and the
Products of the Soil' and ''Mining.' On the loft, ''votive
Power, Scientific and Mechanical Appliances'' and ''the
Designer and Mechanic.''
This appeared in the Evening Mail Illustrated
Saturday Magazine of June 18, 1904 several days after
the unveiling ceremonies.
June, 1904
Gift of Urbrock Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED
NVEG ~ EE35
716833f.folder: Broad Street & Wall Street, Manhattan, NY

723857f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Broad Street
723857f-a.text:
Wall Street (left), at the S. E. corner of Broad Street
(right), showing the Morgan Drexel \&: Co. building decorated
for the Hudson Fulton Celebration. At the left margin is
the U. S. Sub Treasury at the N. E. corner of Nassau Street.
September 30, 1909

723879f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Nassau Street
723879f-a.text:
Vall Street, at the N.W. corner of Nassau Street, showing
AEM4er  at that location, the Gillenden Building. This
was replaced by the 32 story Bankers Trust Company Building. This
property is reported to have brought one of the highest prices in
New York real estate dealings, 825 per square foot. The writer
believes that the vantage point for the photographer is atop the
former Schmerhorn Building on Broadway and that he is viewing
southeastward.
April 28, 1910
Gift of Albert A. Volk Company
A. R. Bond
Irving Underhill
NO REPRODUCTIONS
723879f-a.folder: Wall Street & Nassau Street, Manhattan, NY

723905f-a.title: Manhattan: Nassau Street - Wall Street
723905f-a.text:
Nassau Street, west side, from Wall (left) to Pine (right)
Streets, showing the new Bankers Trust Building and the adjoining
Hanover National Bank Building. The latter is at the S. W. corner
of Nassau and Pine Streets. This site, in conjunction with the
Astor Building (left margin) was absorbed into the later enlarged
Bankers Trust Building.
Note the Singer Tower at the right.
1911
Gift of Urbrock Collection
Copyright 1911
George P. Hall and Son

2-56 Broad Street, west sde, from 7all Street to north of

723860f.text:
10 Wall Street, north side, between Nassau Street and Broadway, as
viewed northward on New Street. The fenced lot shown on the right is at

(1)
Wall Street, north side, adjoining and east of the N.E.
corner of Nassau Street.
May 12, 1929.

(2)
The same, from a view point slightly further westward and showing a
more inclusive view. The 4-story structure on the left is the U.S.
Assay Office, No. 30-k2 and adjoins the U.S. Sub Treasury (at the corner).
Under demolition are Nos. 34-36 (former Gallatin National Bank) and 38,
which in conjunction with the balance of buildings on this block, will
form the 70-storied Bank of Manhattan Building. On the right appears the
entrance to J.P. Morgan and Co. Building. at the S.E. corner of Broad and
Wall Streets.
May 12. 1929.

to the improvement. Wall Street is on the left, while

723858f.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Broad Street
723858f.text:
Wall Street (left) east from Broad (right) to Hanover Streets, showing
the strtcture at the S.E. corner of the first point under demolition.
J. B. Morgan and Co. occupy a 4-story structure at this location today
(1938). On the right appears the east side of Broad Street, south to
and including Exchange Place with the 10-story Mills Building (now the
site of the 38-story Ecquitable Trust Co. Building) at the N.E. corner of
the latter point. Across the Place and at its S.E. corner is the 21-
story Broad Exchange Building. On the extreme left appears the Umited
States Sub-Treasury Building. This set consists of a negative and a
positive.
May 12, 1913.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Co.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

at South Street and Old Slip.
